title: 10 Ways To Increase Your Productivity
summary: The most important thing you can do to boost your productivity is to plan your day the night before. Don’t multitask — focus on one thing at a time. Exercise regularly helps your brain stay focused and alert, improve your memory and even help you sleep better at night. Use noise-cancelling headphones to block out distractions while working in busy rooms. Find a quiet room away from the hustle and bustle of life to create a healthy, productive environment and collaborate with your colleagues.

If you can consistently and measurably increase your productivity, that means you are getting more work done in the same amount of time. It may sound like an unimportant concept to focus on, but the benefits of having high productivity are clear: You produce more results and have more free time to do other things you enjoy.
If you\u2019re constantly busy but don\u2019t feel like you\u2019re productive, it might be because your workload is too heavy or because your workflow isn\u2019t optimized for peak performance. Luckily, there are plenty of ways to improve your productivity that are fairly easy to implement. Try these 10 tips to increase your productivity at work, home and everywhere in between!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

This gives you the ability to wake up with a clear idea of what needs to happen and what your priorities are.
If your job doesn\u2019t require you to plan your day out, it\u2019s absolutely essential that you do it anyway. Your ability to plan and organize is critical to your productivity because it determines how much you\u2019ll get done.
If you\u2019re a manager, plan your team\u2019s day. If you\u2019re an individual contributor, plan your own day. If you\u2019re a parent or a spouse or someone with multiple responsibilities, plan your day and your family\u2019s day. You\u2019ll thank yourself profusely.`),mdx("h2",null,"Automate everything you can"),mdx("p",null,`Whenever you can, automate everything you can. If you\u2019re using software to do tasks or manage projects, do you really need a human being to be doing them? What if you could get the software to run itself?
These days, it\u2019s easier than ever to automate tasks with the help of software. If you have repetitive activities that don\u2019t require your intellectual capacity, use software to automate them.
You can save even more time by automating common communications. This might include setting up auto-responses for emails, or even creating and sending a canned email to a group of people.
If you have any repetitive work tasks, look for ways to automate them so you have more time for creative and strategic thinking.`),mdx("h2",null,"Use a task management app"),mdx("p",null,`Task management apps have quickly become the productivity tool of choice. Most productivity experts recommend using a task management app as part of your daily workflow. This way, you can keep track of your daily goals and stay organized as you complete each task.
These days, you can find a task management app to fit any workflow. Whether you want to be very visual and like to use boards or prefer a more text-based approach, there\u2019s an app for that.`),mdx("h2",null,"Don\u2019t multitask \u2014 focus on one thing at a time"),mdx("p",null,"Multitasking can actually hurt your productivity. Instead, you\u2019re switching between tasks and wasting time because you\u2019re not completing any of them.
Try focusing on one task at a time. If you have more than one project going on at the same time, pick the most important one and work on just that until it\u2019s done.
This way, you\u2019re getting more done in the same amount of time, which will reflect in your productivity.`),mdx("h2",null,"Exercise regularly"),mdx("p",null,`Exercise is one of the best ways to improve your productivity. It can help your brain stay focused and alert, improve your memory and even help you sleep better at night.
If you\u2019re someone who\u2019s easily distracted, exercise regularly to keep yourself on track and focused on your work.
Exercise has also been shown to increase your energy level, which can help you work more efficiently. This can be especially beneficial if you work in an office and need to be able to sit at a desk for long periods of time.`),mdx("h2",null,"Don\u2019t work in busy rooms \u2014 use noise-cancelling headphones"),mdx("p",null,`Lots of offices have open-concept floor plans, where you can see and hear other people working. Or, if you can\u2019t escape the noise, you can use noise-cancelling headphones to help block out distractions.`),mdx("p",null,"If you work from home, you also want to be mindful of the sounds that are around you. Collaborating with other people will help you see perspectives you wouldn\u2019t otherwise see, which can help you solve problems quicker and come up with better ideas.`),mdx("h2",null,"Take regular breaks and have scheduled downtime"),mdx("p",null,`Taking regular breaks throughout your workday is not just a good idea \u2014 it\u2019s a law. You\u2019ll be more productive and happier if you take a break every few hours. You can visit with your team, take a short walk or catch up on household chores when you\u2019re on your break.
This will help you stay focused and avoid burnout.
Bonus: Having a scheduled break is easier than fighting the urge to take a break when you\u2019re feeling tired.`),mdx("h2",null,"Conclusion"),mdx("p",null,"Productivity is all about getting more done in the same amount of time. Without it, we can\u2019t function properly. Studies show that people who get less than six hours of sleep every night have a harder time focusing, are less alert, and are more prone to making mistakes. Did you know that there are even studies that show getting less than five hours of sleep for two weeks straight can lead to hallucinations and other warning signs of declining mental health?
That might be a little bit scary for some people, but the truth is: You need to make sure you\u2019re getting enough rest if you want to remain productive throughout your workday.
